content.question: All the following statements are historically accurate. Which would most strongly support Grunerâ€™s characterization in the second paragraph of the rule of German princes before Napoleon?

choices.label: There were virtually no instances of significant popular rebellions against German princes in the eighteenth century.
Germany was divided in nearly three hundred independent principalities in the eighteenth century.
The Peace of Westphalia had established the idea of state sovereignty as the governing principle for relationships among German states in the eighteenth century.
Most German states in the eighteenth century had an official religion supported by the ruler.

content.answer: There were virtually no instances of significant popular rebellions against German princes in the eighteenth century.

unit.text: 5: Conflict, Crisis, and Reaction in the Late 18th Century

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Explain how claims or evidence support, modify, or refute a source's argument.
